jobDescription: About the job Location: Ia»ôi, Romania (Hybrid work model - 8 days at the office a month)  Company: Hindawi Romania - A Wiley Brand    Our mission is to unlock human potential. We welcome you for who you are and the background you bring, and we embrace individuals who get excited about learning. Bring your experiences, your perspectives, and your passion; it's in our differences that we empower the way the world learns.  We strive for a future where researchers are motivated to work together, empowered with the tools and services they need to do so, and freed from any barriers that stand in their way.  We believe in the power of open scholarly communication to radically improve the research process. We are passionate about working with the research community to promote the transition towards Open Science on a large scale. With the help of our editors, we focus on serving our authors while preserving robust publishing standards and editorial integrity.    About The Company:  Hindawi is one of the world's largest open-access publishers of peer-reviewed journals. Our journals publish thousands of articles annually across all areas of science and medicine, reaching millions of readers. Most of what we build is open-source; therefore, you can get a better idea of the kind of work done so far; just head over to https://gitlab.com/hindawi.    Here are some things we've worked on recently that might give you a better sense of what we're building:  Email Template Manager built by WhoThis team Editor Suggestion Tool built by Qalas team Flexible Editorial Models built by the Rocket team   We value people who can take a stand yet commit even when they disagree. And understand the value in others being heard. We subject ideas to rigorous consideration and challenge each other, but all remember that we're here for the same purpose: to do good work together. That comes with direct feedback, openness to each others' experiences, and willingness to show up for each other as well as for the technical work at hand. We're in this for the long term.  We're a JavaScript shop (Node, Express, NestJS, React, GraphQL) and most of our colleagues are what's known in the industry as the T-Shaped developers. They are well-versed in the backend or front-end and dangerous enough in the other areas to be able to get the job done. But it's not a hard requirement from day 1 for you. It's OK if you have experience only in backend or front-end development if you are open to learning and working on the other areas. We as a company are committed to helping you learn what's needed to get the job done with ease.    About The Role:  We are seeking a Software Engineer as a member of our engineering team to help us develop our flagship product, Phenom. This person should be passionate about software development, with an engineering mindset, with excellent knowledge of computer science concepts and proven experience & expertise with (micro)services and web application development, regardless of the languages or frameworks used.    How You Will Make An Impact:  You'll work in a Scrum team responsible for delivering one or more Phenom components (i.e. Review, Screening, Invoicing, Reporting, Syndication). As a Software Developer, you will be responsible for the following: Delivering solid and maintainable software through good processes Taking ownership over a whole component/product/project's lifecycle, including being involved in the design phase and performing operational tasks such as deployments and monitoring. Mentoring the teams, being a technical role model, and being able to popularize, defend, and reevaluate technical decisions. Work with the product team to define requirements, identify risks, and draft technical solutions. Collaborating with other teams on system-wide parts like platform tooling, common libraries, integrations, etc. Shaping the technical organization by being a go-to person for technical decisions that affect multiple teams. Being a technical ambassador for Hindawi.   What We Look For:  Excellent knowledge of computer science concepts and proven experience & expertise with (micro)services and web application development, regardless of the languages or frameworks used. Take ownership over the whole component/product/project's lifecycle, including being involved in the design phase and performing operational tasks such as deployments and monitoring. Work with the product team to define requirements, identify risks, and draft technical solutions. In addition to technical chops, we aim for someone used to working in a team, who is ecstatic about sharing their knowledge, teaching and mentoring their peers, and understanding the value in others being heard. Willingness to learn new skills and technologies. We use JavaScript frameworks like (Node, Express, NestJS, React, GraphQL, Typescript, and AWS). Most of our colleagues are what's known in the industry as T-Shaped developers. They are well-versed on either the backend or frontend and knowledgeable enough on the other areas to be able to get the job done. Being full-stack is not a requirement from day one but we as a company are committed to helping you learn what's needed to get the job done with ease. No computer science degree mandates. That's not what we're looking for. We care about what you can do and how you do it, not about how you got here. A strong track record of conscientious, thoughtful work speaks volumes.   About Wiley:  Wiley is a trusted leader in research and learning, our pioneering solutions and services are paving the way for knowledge seekers as they work to solve the world's most important challenges. We are advocates of advancement, empowering knowledge-seekers to transform today's biggest obstacles into tomorrow's brightest opportunities.  With over 200 years of experience in publishing, we continue to evolve knowledge seekers' steps into strides, illuminating their path forward to personal, educational, and professional success at every stage. Around the globe, we break down barriers for innovators, empowering them to advance discoveries in their fields, adapt their workforces, and shape minds.    When applying, please attach your resume/CV to be considered.
